# Biography
My name is Xavier Martorell, I’m 21 years old and I'm from Mallorca, Spain.

I’ve been collaborating in Mozilla since I joined Mozilla Hispano in 2013 when a window pop-up on my screen asking for collaboration in Mozilla which I was not willing to refuse. I started helping in the QA Area of Mozilla Hispano with Gabriela Montagu (gaby2300) who later on would become my mentor and a really good friend.   
    
Nowadays, I'm pushing the Mozilla Hispano community forward, introducing them to the new projects which Mozilla is working on as well as trying to engage as many members as possible. This wouldn't be possible without the help of my Mozilla Hispano fellows.

## Current:

Data Scientist, Software Enginner at Cisco, FOSS contributor and Mozilla Rep

## About History:

I still remember when I was in school 8th Standard, say ~13 years back, we were to write small HTML snippets. I used to use a lot of Netscape Navigator browser and then in a year or so, there was this browser named Firefox which I heard a lot. I have that curious mind, which never rests. That was when I started using Firefox. Few years passed, I then thought myself JS. It was(and is) one of the languages I admire(not just code)! That passion for JS & Mozilla grew over years. I explored about Mozilla's History, Present and thought I should be a part of their Future.
Attending every event, contributed as much as I could with that knowledge in those days. Then, got a chance to showcase Mozilla, Firefox, Firefox OS, Gecko in a bigger stage/audience. Have enjoyed the journey all along. Would like to take the next step officially and see what more I could do being a part of this amazing community.

## Interests:

Mozilla, Artificial Intelligence, Javascript

Lean product delivery aficionado. #Agile evangelist. Building Dignity volunteer. @ebbf comms advocate. Leading Mozilla's Open Innovation Participation Systems team.

## Reason for being a Mozilla Rep
I have been a fan of Mozilla ever since the Milestone Releases in 1999. Having attended the [Mozilla 1.0 Release Party in Quito](http://www.schnitzer.at/mozparty/?all=true#42) (Ecuador), I decided to host a [Firefox 1.0 Release Party in Munich](http://web.archive.org/web/20050206171150/http://carishina.net/henrik/blog/?postid=64) (Germany).

In 2010 I participated in the Drumbeat Festival in Barcelona and am part of the Webmaker community ever since.

My main contribution to Mozilla is in the area of community building with a regional focus German-speaking countries.

I became a Mozilla Rep in June 2011 and am a Reps Mentor since November that year.

## Contact Details
You can reach me anytime via email, twitter, and on IRC. Usually I will respond to my email with 48 hours. Please see the contact fields below for the exact coordinates.
